   "body_snippet": "<!--- Provide a general summary of the issue in the Title above -->\r\nSometime it is  happen I open a lot of connections in different folders and subfolders.\r\n## Expected Behavior\r\n\r\n<!--- If you're suggesting a change/improvement, tell us how it should work -->\r\nWhen I click right mouse button on the picture of folder I should see item Close all child connections and Close connections in current folder\r\n## Current Behavior\r\nI see only Item Disconnect\r\n## Your Environment\r\n<!--- Include as many r...",
-  "our_status": "new",
-  "priority": null,
+  "our_status": "triaged",
+  "priority": "P3-enhancement",
   "target_release": null,
   "our_branch": null,
   "our_pr": null,
-  "iterations": [],
+  "iterations": [
+    {
+      "seq": 1,
+      "date": "2026-02-17",
+      "type": "triaged",
+      "description": "Folder disconnect only closes direct child connections, not connections in sub-folders — needs recursive traversal"
+    }
+  ],
   "comments": [
     {
       "id": "MDEyOklzc3VlQ29tbWVudDQxNjcxNjYwOA==",
@@ -41,6 +48,6 @@
   "unread_comments": 2,
   "needs_action": true,
   "waiting_for_us": true,
-  "last_synced": "2026-02-15T09:52:50Z",
-  "notes": ""
+  "last_synced": "2026-02-17T13:38:37Z",
+  "notes": "AI triage (claude): Folder disconnect only closes direct child connections, not connections in sub-folders — needs recursive traversal\nApproach: In DisconnectConnection(), when handling ContainerInfo, recursively traverse all descendant containers (not just direct children) to disconnect all connections. Use ContainerInfo.GetRecursiveChildList() or implement a recursive helper to find all ConnectionInfo descendants with open connections."
 }
diff --git a/.project-roadmap/issues-db/upstream/1084.json b/.project-roadmap/issues-db/upstream/1084.json
index 8e01e48fa..57c5a8108 100644
--- a/.project-roadmap/issues-db/upstream/1084.json

@@ -11,12 +11,19 @@
   "created_at": "2018-08-24T15:46:09Z",
   "github_updated_at": "2021-06-28T11:12:26Z",
   "body_snippet": "<!--- Provide a general summary of the issue in the Title above -->\r\nI have experience with a lot of software which used tree structure and inheritance, but a current system of inheritance is something I am still not able to understand.\r\n\r\n## Expected Behavior\r\n\r\n1. Folder (container) should contain all options which might be inherited by child.\r\n2. By default child should inherit all options from parent.\r\n\r\n## Current Behavior\r\n1. Child contain some options to inherit which parent doesn't have ...",
-  "our_status": "new",
-  "priority": null,
+  "our_status": "triaged",
+  "priority": "P3-enhancement",
   "target_release": null,
   "our_branch": null,
   "our_pr": null,
-  "iterations": [],
+  "iterations": [
+    {
+      "seq": 1,
+      "date": "2026-02-17",
+      "type": "triaged",
+      "description": "Currently, properties not matching a folder's protocol are hidden, making it difficult to configure inheritance for child connections of different protocols. Showing all properties for folders resolves this friction."
+    }
+  ],
   "comments": [
     {
       "id": "MDEyOklzc3VlQ29tbWVudDQxNTgwODA4Ng==",
@@ -51,5 +58,5 @@
   "needs_action": true,
   "waiting_for_us": true,
   "last_synced": "2026-02-15T09:52:50Z",
-  "notes": ""
+  "notes": "AI triage (gemini): Currently, properties not matching a folder's protocol are hidden, making it difficult to configure inheritance for child connections of different protocols. Showing all properties for folders resolves this friction.\nApproach: Update 'ShowHideGridItems' to bypass protocol validation checks when 'SelectedConnectionInfo.IsContainer' is true, effectively displaying all available properties for folder objects."
 }

@@ -51,5 +58,5 @@

-  "notes": ""
+  "notes": "AI triage (gemini): Exporting passwords in clear text is a security risk; adding a warning ensures users are aware before proceeding.\nApproach: In FrmExport.cs, detect when the user selects CSV export.  }

diff --git a/mRemoteNG/UI/Forms/FrmExport.cs b/mRemoteNG/UI/Forms/FrmExport.cs
index f80a745c9..e59846f51 100644
--- a/mRemoteNG/UI/Forms/FrmExport.cs
+++ b/mRemoteNG/UI/Forms/FrmExport.cs
@@ -199,6 +199,15 @@ namespace mRemoteNG.UI.Forms
 
         private void btnOK_Click(object sender, EventArgs e)
         {
+            if (SaveFormat == SaveFormat.mRCSV && IncludePassword)
+            {
+                if (MessageBox.Show("Exporting to CSV will save passwords in clear text. Are you sure you want to continue?",
+                        "Security Warning", MessageBoxButtons.OKCancel, MessageBoxIcon.Warning) != DialogResult.OK)
+                {
+                    return;
+                }
+            }
+
             DialogResult = DialogResult.OK;
         }

         {
+            if (SaveFormat == SaveFormat.mRCSV && IncludePassword)
